verses.kjv: Truly my soul waiteth upon God: from him cometh my salvation.
verses.ct: My soul finds its rest in God alone; my salvation comes from him.

verses.kjv: He only is my rock and my salvation; he is my defence; I shall not be greatly moved.
verses.ct: He alone is my rock and my salvation; he is my fortress — I will never be seriously shaken.

verses.kjv: How long will ye imagine mischief against a man? ye shall be slain all of you: as a bowing wall shall ye be, and as a tottering fence.
verses.ct: How long will all of you attack one person? You will all be destroyed — like a leaning wall, like a fence about to collapse.

verses.kjv: They only consult to cast him down from his excellency: they delight in lies: they bless with their mouth, but they curse inwardly. Selah.
verses.ct: Their only plan is to drag him down from his position of honor. They love deception — they speak blessings with their lips but hurl curses in their hearts. Selah.

verses.kjv: My soul, wait thou only upon God; for my expectation is from him.
verses.ct: My soul, find your rest in God alone, because my hope comes from him.

verses.kjv: He only is my rock and my salvation: he is my defence; I shall not be moved.
verses.ct: He alone is my rock and my salvation; he is my fortress — I will not be shaken.

verses.kjv: In God is my salvation and my glory: the rock of my strength, and my refuge, is in God.
verses.ct: My salvation and my glory depend on God; my mighty rock and my shelter are found in God.

verses.kjv: Trust in him at all times; ye people, pour out your heart before him: God is a refuge for us. Selah.
verses.ct: Put your confidence in him at every moment, people. Open up your hearts in his presence — God is our shelter. Selah.

verses.kjv: Surely men of low degree are vanity, and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance, they are altogether lighter than vanity.
verses.ct: Ordinary people are nothing more than a breath, and important people are an illusion. If placed on a scale together, they weigh less than a breath.

verses.kjv: Trust not in oppression, and become not vain in robbery: if riches increase, set not your heart upon them.
verses.ct: Don't put your confidence in extortion, and don't take pride in stolen goods. If your wealth grows, don't set your heart on it.

verses.kjv: God hath spoken once; twice have I heard this; that power belongeth unto God.
verses.ct: God has said this once, and I have heard it twice: that power belongs to God.

verses.kjv: Also unto thee, O Lord, belongeth mercy: for thou renderest to every man according to his work.
verses.ct: And mercy belongs to you as well, Lord, because you repay each person based on what they have done.
